title: Photos : Class of 2023 valedictorians and top scholars for Orange County high schools
body_text:
Name: Dara Farnoush —
Age: 17 —
High school: Foothill High School —
GPA: 4.88 —
High School Activities or Groups: Co-CEO of OUI Tutor, President of French Club, President of Philosophy-Debate Club, President of Stocks and Investments Club, Executive Producer in Charge of Technical Production and Equipment for Foothill Television, and Board Member of 11 other clubs —

Career Goal: Unknown/Environmental Field —

We asked high schools across Orange County to invite their valedictorians and top scholars to submit their photos and a little bit about themselves to celebrate their achievements as this senior year comes to a close. The following are the high school students who submitted their information, including after-graduation plans, and their career goals.
Congratulations, graduates.
Name: Lexie Rocha —
Age: 18 —
High school: Gilbert High School —
GPA: 3.2 —
High School Activities or Groups: Clubs: GSA (president); Poetry Club (poet laureate); Journalism and Social Justice Club —
After Graduation/College Plans: Attend Golden West College for musical theatre and cosmetology —
Career Goal: Their career goal is to be a singer and actor on Broadway. —
Parents: Manuel and Irene Rocha

Age: 18 —
High school: Cloud Campus —
GPA: 4.36 —
High School Activities or Groups: Production Drama, Korean classes and tutoring —

Age: 18 —
High school: Costa Mesa High School —
GPA: 4.44 —
High School Activities or Groups: Varsity Girls Soccer (Captain), STEM Club (Secretary), National Honors Society, STEM on the Sidelines, ACE Mentorship Program, MESA Engineering. —
After Graduation/College Plans: I plan on attending UCLA, majoring in Chemical Engineering . —
Career Goal: I want to develop new technology that will have the ability to improve the health of individuals. After graduating from college I plan on joining an engineering company, such as Edwards Lifesciences, to continue to pursue my passion in engineering. —
Parents: Karen and Mark Kirsch
